description: This trap is sent when the system restarts for any reason
other than an operator requested restart.

event.Summary: System restarted

description: This trap is sent when the system detects a
inconsistency. This may cause a reset of the FRX node.

event.Summary: System inconsistency detected

description: This trap is sent when a new configuration is saved in
the non-volatile storage.

event.Summary: Configuration changed

description: This trap is sent when the FRX node becomes congested.

event.Summary: FRX node is congested

description: This trap is sent when a port is installed.

event.Summary: Port is installed

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portConfEntryId

description: This trap is sent when a port is deleted.

event.Summary: Port is deleted

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portConfEntryId

event.Summary: Port is activated

description: This trap is sent when a port is disabled.

event.Summary: Port is disabled

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portConfEntryId

description: This trap is sent when a port is congested.

event.Summary: Port $v1 is congested

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.

event.Summary: Virtual circuit on port $v1 is disabled

description: This trap is sent when the status for a virtual circuit
become active.

event.Summary: Virtual circuit status is active on port $v1

become inactive.

description: This trap is sent when the CBUS interface is ready for
use.

event.Summary: CBUS interface is up

description: This trap is sent when the CBUS interface becomes
invalid.

event.Summary: CBUS interface is down

description: This trap is sent when an HDLC port fails to initialize.

event.Summary: HDLC port initialization failed

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portStatusEntryId

description: This trap is sent when a port's UNI protocol becomes
active.

event.Summary: UNI protocol on port $v1 is active

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portStatusEntryId

description: This trap is sent when a port's UNI protocol becomes
inactive.

event.Summary: UNI protocol on port $v1 is inactive

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portStatusEntryId

description: This trap is sent when a port's IDNX call (bandwidth) is
available.

event.Summary: IDNX call on port $v1 is up

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portStatusEntryId

description: This trap is sent when a port's IDNX call (bandwidth)
becomes unavailable.

event.Summary: IDNX call on port $v1 is down

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portStatusEntryId

description: This trap is sent when a FRX node goes from being
congested to not being congested.

event.Summary: FRX node congestion is cleared

description: This trap is sent when a port goes from being congested
to not being congested.

event.Summary: Port $v1 congestion is cleared

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portStatusEntryId

description: This trap is sent when the operator requests a reset of
the FRX.

event.Summary: FRX reset by operator

description: This trap is sent when the operator requests to clear the
FRX event log.

event.Summary: FRX event log cleared by operator

description: This trap is sent when the operator requests to clear the
configuration of an FRX.

event.Summary: FRX configuration cleared by operator

description: This trap is sent when the code type (FRX) does not match
the value stored in the IDNX database.

event.Summary: FRX code type mismatched with the value in IDNX database

description: This trap is sent when the FRX is unable to create an
event log.

event.Summary: FRX failed to create event log

description: This trap is sent when frame relay encapsulation is
turned on for a PVC.

event.Summary: Frame relay encapsulation is active

description: This trap is sent when frame relay encapsulation is
turned off for a PVC.

event.Summary: Frame relay encapsulation is inactive

description: This trap is sent when a path alternate to the preferred
path is used to setup a pvc.

event.Summary: Alternate path is used to setup a pvc

description: The state of a PVC describes the current status of call
setup. This trap is sent when a PVC's state changes to
Idle.

event.Summary: PVC call status is Idle on port $v1

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portConfEntryId

description: The second index into the circuit configuration table.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::circuitConfDLCI

description: The state of a PVC describes the current status of call
setup. This trap is sent when a PVC's state changes to
Setup.

event.Summary: PVC call state is Setup on port $v1

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portConfEntryId

description: The second index into the circuit configuration table.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::circuitConfDLCI

description: The state of a PVC describes the current status of call
setup. This trap is sent when a PVC's state changes to
Complete.

event.Summary: PVC call state is Complete on port $v1

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portConfEntryId

description: The second index into the circuit configuration table.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::circuitConfDLCI

description: The state of a PVC describes the current status of call
setup. This trap is sent when a PVC's state changes to
Disconnect.

event.Summary: PVC call state is Disconnect on port $v1

description: The port identifier (number) for this port.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::portConfEntryId

description: The second index into the circuit configuration table.
variables.name: FRX-MIB::circuitConfDLCI

description: A Billing file was successfully downloaded from the FRX.

event.Summary: Billing file downloaded successfully

description: An error occurred while the FRX attempted to download
a Billing file.

event.Summary: Billing file failed to download

description: An attempt was made to set an obsolete Billing download
threshold parameter.

event.Summary: Billing download threshold is set

description: A line in the FRX configuration file had a syntax
error when it was loaded; the line was ignored.

event.Summary: Syntax error in the FRX configuration file

description: A Configuration file was successfully downloaded from
the FRX.

event.Summary: Configuration file downloaded successfully

description: An error occurred while the FRX attempted to download
a Configuration file.

event.Summary: Configuration file failed to download

description: This trap indicates that a code checksum error occurred in Flash.

event.Summary: Code checksum error occurred in flash

description: This trap indicates that a code transfer to Flash occurred. Flash may
now be corrupted.

event.Summary: Write error in flash - possible memory corruption

description: A user has logged into the FRX through the serial console or network.

event.Summary: User logged in

description: A user has logged out.

event.Summary: User logged out

description: No alarm present.

event.Summary: No alarm is present on DSX-1

event.Summary: New operator is installed

description: This trap is sent when an operator is deleted.

event.Summary: Operator is deleted
